data.meta_description: Geocaching is a treasure hunting game where you use a GPS to hide and seek containers with other participants in the activity. Geocaching.com is the listing service for geocaches around the world.

Kasztelan Antoni (1896 - 1942)

Navy captain of the Republic of Poland, participant in the Greater Poland Uprising and Polish-Bolshevik war, executed in German captivity

He was born in Greater Poland. Already in high school as a Prussian subject he risked belonging to the scouts and distributing Polish books. For the fight in the Greater Poland Uprising he was awarded the Silver Cross of Merit.

He graduated from the Greater Poland Infantry Officer Cadet School in PoznaÅ„ as a second lieutenant, he participated in the Polish-Bolshevik war, previously offering all his assets to the State Treasury.

From 1931 he served in the Naval Battalion in Wejherowo, in 1943 transferred to the staff of the Fleet Command in Gdynia. As the head of the Independent Information Department, he worked out and liquidated German espionage cells operating on the coast. In the September campaign, he defended Hel in the staff of Admiral JÃ³zef Unrug until honorary surrender. Imprisoned first with other prisoners of war in Nienburg, he soon found the Gestapo in GdaÅ„sk. After two months of torture, in retaliation for pre-war counterintelligence activities, he was imprisoned in Stutthof as a political prisoner. In the camp, he joined the underground, assembled and operated a short-wave radio.
